snippet: Federal agents in New York moved to seize a thousand-year-old Cambodian statue from Sotheby’s, alleging that Sotheby’s knew that it had been stolen from an ancient temple.
abstract: Federal agents in New York move to seize a thousand-year-old Cambodian statue from Sotheby’s, which new evidence suggests was looted from a temple during the Cambodian civil war in the 1970s.

byline.original: By RALPH BLUMENTHAL and TOM MASHBERG

lead_paragraph: Federal agents in New York moved to seize a thousand-year-old Cambodian statue from Sotheby’s, alleging that Sotheby’s knew that it had been stolen from an ancient temple.

headline.seo: Ancient Cambodian Statue Is Seized From Sotheby’s
headline.main: Officials Are Set to Seize Antiquity
headline.print_headline: Officials Are Set To Seize Antiquity
